WRITING.TEXT: Coming from NYC where uber is pretty expensive, we loved that between some resorts cost us, literally, $4. In NYC it'd be easily $10! Always came quickly. We used it between French Quarter and the camp grounds, French Quarter and Contemporary, French Quarter and Boardwalk Inn. All quick and cheap rides.
Designing Disney, Since the World Began, The Disney Mountains: Imagineering at it's Peak.
holy mother of.... that's amazing.
Once a month or 6 weeks, id say. Depending on what has run out!

I used magical moringa, definitely a repurchase for me. Also sympathy for the skin for the rest of my body, also a definite repurchase! Tonight I'll use Yog Nog soap (will buy next season im sure!) and Buffy (a freakin' staple!).
@IvyWinterYT Im always trying to get some good conversation going for sure!
Don't be. They didn't have my package. They even let me into the back to help look! Now i have to contact ups that it's miSsing

I think it's totally ok if you do a series of one off videos on old games, as a revisit. that's always a fun! a long let's play series? probably won't get many views as you go on. But id be a liar if i said i didnt sometimes go on youtube and search old games just to get some nostalgia kicks.
Well, mine came, but since I wasn't home they dropped it off at a pick up location. Gotta get it on the way home!

Another vote for Magical Moringa. I have very dry cheeks but oily as hell nose and forehead and this stuff works wonderful. I also use Sympathy for the Skin at night or on weekends (because its obviously shinier) andi t works well too. It seems thick, but i dont have any added breakouts or anything.
In New York too. Mine's been upstate for Like 3 days. I'm in Manhattan. Like, get here already!

I too would love to know what signals to give. I'm a "leave me alone" shopper in general. If i need help i certainly, 100% ask every time. But 9 times out of 10, wherever i am, i dont. I either want what i want and want to leave, or just want to take a look and then if a question springs from that, cool! i'll ask! I am just not a super social person with strangers in general it gives me a lil anxiety so if there's something i could do or say that would really put the stop on it unlessi ask, that would be awesome!
Thanks! i guess ill have to see when it gets here! interesting about the reverse color transfer though!

Hi all! - reposting here as requested. Cambridge Satchel is having a big sale so I snatched the classic batchel in red as i need a new bag for carrying my work laptop back and forth. Then after i bought it i read that the color can transfer, especially on lighter clothes. I have a beige wool trench coat I wear for the winter and now im so scared it's going to get ruined. Anyone have any experience with color transfer? Should i have gone with the classic brown? Any tips on how to stop color transfer if it should happen?

WRITING.TITLE: Sudden Onset of Possibly Allergy Reaction to Alcohol?
WRITING.TEXT:
29/F here, from NYC. 5'2, 115lbs, half hispanic half white. In very good health, last had a yearly exam in september and everything came back wonderful.
I have always drank wine, beer, alcohol no problem. probably imbibe about 3 drinks a week, not a heavy drinker by any means and never was. Was fine through the holidays, having beer and wine for christmas eve/christmas, then suddenly this past tuesday, 12/29, i had a very odd reaction to a glass of sauvignon blanc (a wine i always drink). My throat felt tight and swollen, my nose stuffed up almost immediately, and i felt light headed. I freaked out, stopped drinking the glass (got halfway through). Then NYE, i had a glass of champagne, same reaction. It happens about 5-10 minutes after my first few sips. Freaked out again, worried about a closing throat, though i could breathe, it just felt tight.
Last night, i stayed away from wine, thinking it was a sudden allergy, tried a cocktail with vodka and amaretto in it. 3 sips in, i had the reaction. Passed on that.
I have an appointment with an allergist on the 12th. I feel fine in the in between, i did read this type of reaction is common in hodgkin's lymphoma (oh yeah, thanks internet for freaking me out) but my throat has felt fine, no swelling otherwise. I can say that from about 12/25 to 12/27 i was sick with a bad cold and swollen glands, pain swallowing, but that passed. I am unsure if this has anything to do with the reaction im having. Does alcohol allergy manifest in this way? could it be something worse? of course im super worried now until my allergy appointment on the 12th. ive otherwise been in fine health, no other symptoms.

WRITING.TITLE: They Won't Kill a Toddler, Right?
This is what happens when you try to fit two adults in one Astro Orbiter ship...

WRITING.TEXT: I did a late purchase yesterday after they restocked. so who knows! nothing yet.

I also use magical Moringa in the morning specifically because I like the matte finish and it does work well as a primer for makeup like some others said. It also doesn't make me shiny so that's why I like to use it at the start of my day and then I'll use a more traditional moisturizer before I go to bed since I care less about the shininess. I'm actually not a fan of the smell as much but it grew on me after a while and the other benefits of it outweighed fragrance

WRITING.TITLE: Wanted to Share Our Hoop Dee Doo experience!

WRITING.TEXT: My good friends know. My boss knows, because sometimes i'm late to work because of it. She's super understanding. And my boyfriend knows, we live together but he also knew a good 2 years prior, because he was with me when things got bad a couple years ago and iwent through all my tests, colonoscopy,etc. Some of my co workers know i have a "sensitive stomach" but that's the extent of it.

Hi all. I can't seem to find a cleanser that doesn't dry me out. I have a clarisonic brush i got recently as a gift and thought it was the brush itself, but im finding i used the cleanser alone and it still gives me tight, dry feeling skin after. I tried the Clinique one and that didn't help, I went to the deep pore one and that's just a little better. I've even tried a cleansing milk that unfortunately I cant think of the brand off the top of my head, but supposed to be gentle, and im still dry. I moisturize, and well, and feel fine after I do that, but its always right after using a soap I feel so dry and super tight and I hate it. Would love a suggestion on something that won't make me feel that way!

Probably my make up (eye make up specifically, i get Urban Decay's Vice palette every year and work with that), and my necklaces. I'm not a real ring wearer, and my wrists are far too tiny for most bracelets to not fly right off. But i have a bunch of different necklaces that i switch off or layer and it changes everything.
Sweeet! I used to live around there. They film near/around my office in Dumbo a lot, but I never paid attention as I wasn't a fan until recently. Gonna keep a look out!

I'm ibs-d and deal with incomplete evacuation. Fiber helps a bit also wet wipes are Your friend. I unfortunately deal with marks left in underwear no matter how clean i try to wipe but wet wipes fix that a lot.
The funny thing was he wasn't even my companion at the time. I had dismissed him for Preston and he was just walking to another settlement and decided now is a good time to have this conversation.

WRITING.TEXT: I never bought Cole Haan anything before I worked at my current job because it was out of my usual price point. Now I own 3 pairs of shoes a a handbag and am looking at another handbag haha it's dangerous!

Well, I didn't purchase [these boots](http://www.colehaan.com/zer%C3%B8grand-waterproof-hiker-boot-black-elderberry-waterproof/W00157.html?dwvar_W00157_color=Black-Elderberry%20Waterproof dwvar_W00157_width=B#cgid=womens_shoes_ZG start=1), but asked my boyfriend to for my birthday next week. I get a 40% off discount because Cole Haan is my agency's client. They came in today and the leather feels so nice! They fit true to size and are really comfy. I love them!

WRITING.TITLE: 28/f/NYC Looking For Email Penpal!
WRITING.TEXT:
I've done this once before about a year ago and unfortunately lost touch with some of my penpals. I am from NYC, born and raised, looking for someone to really chat with. Don't mind small talk at first to get to know each other but I'm looking for someone I can look to get advice from with work, relationships (I'm in a long term one, live with my boyfriend), life and to provide some advice back. And just to learn something new, wax poetic, bitch about the day with, whatever it may be!
I'm super passionate about gaming, not just playing video games but the whole industry. I love to travel and so far my most exciting trip was to Morocco; would love to hear from someone who has suggestions on places to go or awesome travel stories. I work in social media and always love to talk about that as well as tech and all that cool stuff. I got into sewing over a year ago but fell off that wagon but am trying to get inspired to get back into it again. I think that Buffy the Vampire Slayer is the greatest t.v. show that ever existed, but Breaking Bad is a close second.
If there's anything you can relate to (or heck, have a counterpoint on!) please PM me!

I adore the flare look thats coming out, but man i feel way too short for them. at 5'2, flares just dont work for me. I look like im drowning in them. But i actually really admire the look on some of the taller ladies in my office already rocking them. I'm sure i won't have a hard time finding skinnies though, i think they'll be around enough to pick up new pairs.

I have totally deleted video files before exporting from Premiere. I thought I had already, so I deleted the raw footage...then when I came back to it some time later after realizing it was never exported, I opened the project and it said it couldn't find the files, I damn near cried at my stupidity. Got over it and moved on to more videos. Shit happens! But you are not the only one, trust me.

I less notice bad outfits, more notice women who wear shoes they can't walk in (like high heels or weird platforms). I just want to be like "no no no, if you can't walk why wear them?" It's like, a sympathetic "why you do dat" than judgement.

I walk 15 minutes to my subway stop and then 5 more minutes once I get off, to my office. It definitely keeps me from wearing heels as much as I'd like. I don't need "work shoes"because i have a casual office environment so it's very easy to just go with flat shoes all the time and not bothering carrying anything. My heels get little love now-a-days.

I work in a digitial agency in NYC. Dumbo, Brooklyn, specifically. I'm an engagement manager. I can wear pretty much my entire wardrobe (the dress code rules are pretty minimall) and, well, I do! If i know im seeing clients I wear either a decent dress with heels but even yesterday I met with a client in gray jeans, black chelsea boots and a long sleeve black blouse. She was in jeans herself even though she was a big corporate client. It's kind of nice to work in the digial/social media world.

In truth, I let's play games I already want to play. Some do well, some not at all, but I don't know if I'd enjoy it if I worried too much about playing what would do well if I'm not into it personally

I was fine the first 4 days, doing 2 bottles a day and 1 regular meal. Suddenly day 5, some serious issues. while at work. so that was awkward. I cut down to 1 bottle today and im ok. Going to try 2 again tomorrow.
Are you doing it 100%? I've definitely felt better, but maybe not to the extent you are! then again I'm doing 800 calories soylent and 400-500 more reg food a day.

I just literally texted the same to a friend; growing on me for sure. I wasn't sure if i could do it, with my second bottle on friday. Today, ive had 6 bottles total including those 2 since then, and am looking forward to my lunch bottle. Flavoring it really helps, with choc syrup or coffeemate or something, but in general it's grown to be much more palatable over time.
Put some hot chocolate powder into mine. Works well; haven't tried chocolate syrup to compare.

According to tracking shipping info was sent to fedex at 3:30 in the afternoon, and arrived at the fedex facility at 7:26 pm. So, things were moving already, i just only got the email about it about 15-20 minutes ago.

WRITING.TITLE: Got a Soylent Shipping Notification It Arrives Tomorrow! Huzzah!
WRITING.TEXT: Just an update that I ordered my first ever batch of soylent, 2.0, last monday. It has finally shipped, after the delay, and fedex tracking says it should be to me tomorrow. Granted, it shipped from a PA warehouse and I live in NYC, so probably faster than some, but they ARE shipping!

None, but i work at a digital agency with no formal dress code. I do have "nicer" clothes if i know im seeing clients, otherwise, my entire wardrobe can be worn here (including shorts and tank tops, though i keep my shorts a respectable length here and only don non-spaghetti strap tanks). Thank the flying spaghetti monster!

Everything? No. Items that I pull out of the closet/drawer and just seem to attract wrinkles like crazy? Yes. Best way to see how well put together you'll look is to try it on before ironing then after. Trust me, it'll be a noticeable difference! I hate ironing, but there are certain tops and dresses of mine I have to otherwise I look ridiculous.it's worth it!
I hash no idea. So sad now :-(
The Cardinal is better than Root bone, personally.
I'm stuck at matchmaking for Terrorist Hunt. I've been sitting here almost 10 minutes and not a single player has joined.
Being online buddies might not be quite the same, but please feel free to chat with me if you ever feel lonely! about IBS or just life!

I also agree it could be stress. That can affect anyone's stomach. Best to wait it out especially when you get into a less stressful period of your life. if it still exists, then maybe see a doctor. but stress can do a lot to you physically!
That sucks, just placed my first ever order 2 days ago. Oh well, guess there's nothing I can do but wait.

oh we had a long talk about it after the trip. I was standoffish the past few days because i felt burned/insulted by the way he acted. He's definitely feeling guilty about it; especially because last year he brought me out to Michigan, a place he grew up going every year,a nd its totally out of my element. I admit, i didnt love it. But i did it for him. I brought up the similarities and he said he couldnt even defend himself. I mean, "it's too late now" in terms of like, he still acted as he did. But i made it very clear how it made me feel, and that i want more respect for the things i enjoy and love, and if that sort of behavior were to happen again it'd start to become a strain on us.
Yup, thats where I am. Oh well, everyones different, right?

maybe. we just had a bit of a talk about just respecting the things i love, and acting with tact even when put in situations that are out of our element. It's clear he's starting to feel very bad about how he acted. Not that i wanted to make him feel bad, necessarily, i just think he's understanding that it hurt my feelings a little.

You know, yesterday we went to epcot and it was surprisingly very manageable, even for a weekend day. Friday was insane for food wine but sunday tamed down drastically. So don't be petrified! Maybe hit it on a weekday?
We're from NYC. I remember going in October and it being bearable. Didn't expect it to feel like 103 every day this week though. lesson learned, none of us will be returning in september!

the crowds were very unexpected, and i did my darnedest to plan things out well with crowd calendars etc but everyone in my party was surprised, and so were strangers we talked to, about how many people were there this past week. sometimes, you just hit a bump in the road. It probably didn't help (and is why we are planning to go back during january!)

he isnt, actually. he's such a silly guy, normally. SUPER silly. Not a day goes by he isnt singing, whistling, dancing around, cracking jokes. That's why i didnt understand the disney hate, i thought he'd be in his element of acting like a kid. nope. something about the combo of too many people/waiting in line/ and not getting the disney "advertising" that turned him right off.

he does love golf! and he did say he'd take kids, but only once. (i think he only went once as a kid and felt that was "enough" i guess?). I told him maybe the kids would just have to come with me and it'll be mommy bonding time every few years :P
I rode it on the 26th and did not see many differences, to be honest! I noticed a couple new outfits, that was about it.

He actually overall told me he liked epcot the best. He liked food wine a lot, and he thought world showcase was interesting, but he's also been to most of those countries already (save for china and japan) so it just doesnt "do it" for him because he's seen it in person, and i 100% get that. But thankfully we agreed on Epcot being the best park, and Mission: Space, the best ride (he freaking LOVED it, we did it twice and he was willing to do it a third time but we wanted to get a few more other things in).

it was the heat + crowds + lines. He told me he just hates amusement/theme parks as a whole, and though he appreciated the thrill rides, and the theming a lot, he just hated the people there (as in guests, not CMs), the long waits, and pretty much sweating 24/7. I thought it being disney he'd have a better time than say, six flags, but ive learned he just hates amusement parks as a general rule.

thank you! It is 100% not a deal breaker. we've been together almost 4 years...he's a wonderful boyfriend in every other sense, has a wonderful family i love, and has a great sense of adventure with international trips. He's more a "visit new countries" guy, less a "theme park" guy. We've gone to Morocco, Iceland and Spain together and had wonderful times. Clearly, those are the trips meant for us a couple and I'll stick with friends for disney. he understands im still going to go, it's not like he's trying to stop me. he just...doesn't want to be a part of it.

haha we definitely made those jokes more than once. i think after day 2 i said, you know what? don't enjoy it. im going to enjoy it with my friends over here, and you can feel like the odd man out!....that made him be a bit better the last few days. but he definitely didnt fall in love with it or anything.

i have. i know a couple of friends who went and have no desire to go back, unfortunately. he's just one of those people. i find disney very polarizing. you either are into it, or not. its unfortunate he's not, but ive never dated a guy who did like it, which is also unfortunate.

wow. thats harsh words for a guy you never met. he said he'd go with kids, at least once. i think he just never wants to go back without kids, he doesn't see the point. but thanks for insulting him when in literally all other aspects of our relationship he's fantastic, it just so happens he dislikes a vacation destination i like. Don't know if thats grounds to reconsider a whole relationship, but thats just me.

WRITING.TITLE: A Day at DCA Through the Eyes of a WDW Vet!
Update on Trip with Cynical Boyfriend...
WRITING.TEXT:
We're back as of last night and... he hated it. Absolutely hated it. The only things he liked were California Grill, parasailing, and Flying Fish/the boardwalk. He hated everything about the parks and would "jokingly" complain but sometimes it was kind of harsh. And when I told him to please try and be more composed about it, he would just get quiet and standoffish, even with friends around. He basically told me he never wants to go ever again.
it probably didn't help that for "off season" this past week was PACKED, and also felt like over 100 every day. I realize those are tough things to deal with. But he just didn't "get it", as he told me at dinner at california grill. Nothing clicked. Thought he was being hit over the head with messaging, felt like the place "forced him to have fun" etc. He was like "i understand you love it, i accept that you love it, i just don't get it."
So...my friends and I are planning January 2017. Without him.
Yes, i am very, very sad he hated it. But i can't change anything about that. He'll be my international travel buddy (he loves going to different countries, he's been to a lot of them, so he didnt get the point of world showcase, for instance "just GO to those countries!") and he knows i will still come back to the parks every 2 years with friends, and we left it at that.
Oh well. So much for him feeling the magic :(
I was given the "one time now as adults, one time with the kids" talk. Maybe that future trip with the kids will be the one that does it ;)
Thanks! That does sound like some hope :)
Yes, I'm keeping this in mind!

Ive always managed to date guys who don't love it haha cursed. Though my boyfriend now is like, the man im going to marry. Like, we've discussed it and sometime in the next couple of years, it'll happen. I guess there's too much other great stuff in our relationship to not work it out because of Disney, but it does kind of suck, i won't lie.

WRITING.TITLE: Leaving Tonight With Cynical Boyfriend...Wish Me Luck!
WRITING.TEXT:
well, today is the day. After about 6 months of planning, I'm heading to Disney World for my 10th trip and i'm EXCITED! Well, except for the fact that my boyfriend (who is 27, hasnt been since he was 9) has not come around. I gave him a few outs. I have been down there on my own, meeting friends, while we were dating. I had no problem doing it again. Did I want him to come because Disney World means so much to me and I want to share that with him? Yes. But not if he'll be unhappy.
We're meeting 2 friends down there, along with my brother (who is older, 34) and his girlfriend, so there will be a group of us. we're doing California grill tomorrow night, Flying Fish saturday night, parasailing saturday morning, food and wine on Friday (couple things as a group, california grill is a date night for us though)..all the pretty adult things you can do. His attitude is just making me dread this trip and I don't want us to have a crappy time because he's grumpy mcgrumperson.
So..wish me luck he comes around by the time we get down there! Or else this is going to be a long 5ish days.

Yes. I was on Lexapro for a year to manage symptoms, it helped tremendously. My doctor used it as a short term treatment, not long term ands while I do have bad days now I used to have bad days 5 times a week. Now it's 1 or 2.

TOMORROW FOR ME! I'm losing my mind. My friends arrived last night, my brother and his girlfriend this morning. I'm having major FOMO! I couldn't go down with them because my boyfriend has pretty limited vacation time. So now im going crazy seeing their snapchats and instagrams!

The first time I went on ToT i waa 12. I admittedly cried a little going on, I was so anxious. By the time I came off it, I was grinning ear to ear and wanted to go again. The nervousness before hand is MUCH more intense than the ride itself!
I live in nyc so we've had it here for about 8 years now. I think some other states now have it as well. Thanks for the heads up!
Is that top from the parks? It's awesome!
It opens on the 26th, i think, and I leave the 27th, so im hoping I can get a last minute ride in!
me too me too! aaaah im going crazy!
They tend to send them out within the next day or two, after customization day. Mine made it to me 4 days later, to NYC.
we land the night of the 22nd! YEEEEEES!
Been a rumor for a long time but yeah with the new show, it'd be dumb to have nothing! I'm sure they'll put something else related in the parks
Keith had been a friend of mine for 7 years :-) he definitely was a great guide!

WRITING.TITLE: Just Wanted to Share My First Trip to Disneyland!

WRITING.TEXT: I'm going parasailing for the first time on bay lake (from the contemporary). Pricey but I'm pretty sure it'll be awesome!
Oh maaan adding to my list to eat.
I went to Iceland in May... it's a really big saying over there too (and honestly, even more true almost to the minute!)

I definitely have a countdown on my fridge! I've been checking for better reservations too. Got cali grill for 9:25 on 9/23 and while we can arrive early and watch wishes, I'm still trying to get an 8pm or so. We can still watch wishes and not end up leaving there so late then, but obviously that's a coveted time. Nothing has opened before 9pm in months!

yes, nostalgia. honestly, just that. And its funny, when i first saw it, i was 2. i didnt remember a thing. But my brother was 7, and talked about it to no end. when i got to see it again in 2013, aside from watching it on youtube which we did once in a while, it was just...nice to see the show my brother loved so much.
we're going back together in 2 weeks (first time in 12 years we've been together) and i cant wait to check it out with him, just for the memory of it.
But sure, im not fighting to save it. there could be a new updated something.
Yeah. whoa. Let's not get my hopes up here!
Indiana Jones form Disneyland! Would love to ride that over in HS or something.
it's home to me too, thats how i always try to explain it to people! 3

I first went when i was 2. My dad recorded it on VHS (it was 1988) on one of those big bulky camcorders. I obsessed over this video as a child. 10 years later, we went again. 4 years later, again. Then i got invited by friends' families a couple of times. I was hooked. In college, I was a CM at the World of Disney on 5th ave here in NYC (RIP, we closed it down 2009) and that was it. As if i wasnt in love enough with WDW, seeing the company from the inside just grew my love. And ever since I started working for my own paycheck, i just kept saving and going with friends as adults. Can't wait until I have kids in the future to pass the love on to :)
Awesome thank you for the recommendation! I feel like now htat I've finally been there, I want to really start diving into DL in depth and learn more!

WRITING.TITLE: How Do You Guys Deal With the Excitement?
WRITING.TEXT: Going on my 10th trip to WDW and i still can never deal with the hype/excitement. I have 18 days left and i dont know what to do with myself! try to bury myself in work when i can, but that doesn't always work. This holiday weekend im not traveling so I just rented Tangled on Amazon since ive never seen it, and I'm planning on some trip youtube video viewing among other things. What do you guys do to help with the excitement as you count down the days?!
Oh really? I've never heard of him, but now of course I'll have to check him out (and maybe we'll see US in HIS video :) ) Thanks for the heads up!
18 for me. I'm losing my mind waiting in anticipation! Hope you have a great trip!
Totally agree, Illuminations is much better than Wishes. Wishes is nice but Illuminations is just...incredible. But in the end, i guess it's all just subjective :)

Most of my trips id take 6 am, 7 am flights from NYC and be in the parks by 10 or 11. I can't do that anymore. It's way too tiring, because we'd plan that first day as a full park day and id be falling asleep in line by early evening. This trip, I'm flying in after work on a Tuesday, and wont be at Port Orleans French Quarter til likely 11:30pm, and then go right to bed. It'll be nice to have a good night's sleep before our day 1 of the parks!

WRITING.TITLE: Disneyland Vlog - 1st Time Trip Through Eyes of WDW Lover!

WRITING.TEXT: I was very much hoping for this month, because I'm going in a couple of weeks but at this point I won't hold my breath

Doing more sit downs this trip than usual, i can often get by on just quick service. And since I'm paying for the California Grill dinner, my treat, for 2, id say my budget this time around is easily over $500. But usually? probably just $200 for a few days, for just myself.
Loved reading this, as a Disney "vet". Put a little warmth in my heart! It sounds like you guys had a fantastic time. So what was your favorite park? Sounds to me like it was either MK or Epcot!

Oh yeah I mean I have C, I have for 3 years, but in this way has been few and far between so I thought it odd it was fairly prevalent. Usually I'm gassy up till the bm, then the bm is painful and very soft (or straight diarrhea on worst days). This is gassy even during, but the bm isn't painful and is soft but still has substance, and it's fairly quick, just urgent. In a way that's been harder for me to hold in because I feel the gas pushing it out. I'm just trying to figure out why it's suddenly happening.
Oh hi! :-) thanks so much! We'll be doing the same in WDW!

WRITING.TITLE: Passing Gas during BM?
WRITING.TEXT: As of late I've had some very gassy BMs that have been tough to deal with, to say the least. I feel the urge pretty severely, i go to the bathroom and am literally passing gas as im passing very gassy (and i assume fatty?) floating stool. Thing is, recently i cant account for any particularly fatty or greasy foods ive eaten, at least not in a week+. However, before that I went on a trip to Disneyland and in fear of feeling ill from the food there, took immodium and then didnt have a BM for about 4 days. Could this literally be a "back up" from that? has anyone else had these very gassy BMs? I am going on a work camping trip wednesday to friday (well, not real camping, in cabins with bathrooms, thank god) and im nerovus about the 90 minute ride and everything. I just want this to pass! literally!

in 2013, I went to Morocco on a wonderful trip, and then to WDW for a very short impromptu trip 2 weeks later. It was magical to walk through the Morocco pavilion and really realize how perfect it is to the actual country, it felt like i was transported back. On top of that, when I told the CMs from there that I had just been there, they were BEAMING! They were so excited to talk with me about what i thought of their home country and it was just a wonderful exchange. i could've spoken to them for hours.
I'm 28, boyfriend is 27, friends are 27, brother is 34 and his girlfriend is 28!

I have 2 days left to customize so... mine are coming soooon! So excited! Hope you have a great trip. OH! and since my 30 days are up Sunday...question...do these ship on Sunday? or will it likely be Monday?
